Creation Force.quote: In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth. The earth was formless and void, and darkness was over the surface of the deep. (Genesis 1:1-2)

Prana.quote: Prana is the vital force that pervades the whole cosmos; it is the link between matter and energy. (Upanishads)

Holy Spirit.quote: And the Spirit of God was hovering over the waters, bringing forth creation. (Genesis 1:2)

Qi.quote: Qi is the force that animates all things, flowing between heaven and earth. (Traditional Chinese Medicine)

Kundalini.quote: The serpent power rises through the chakras, awakening divine consciousness. (Yoga Sutras)

Divine Love.quote: Love is the force that transforms and improves the Soul of the World. (Paulo Coelho, The Alchemist)

Dharma.quote: Dharma sustains the universe; it is the cosmic force of righteousness. (Bhagavad Gita)

Logos.quote: In the beginning was the Logos, and the Logos was with God, and the Logos was God. (John 1:1)

Karma.quote: As you sow, so shall you reap - the cosmic force of cause and effect. (Brihadaranyaka Upanishad)

Shakti.quote: Shakti is the primordial cosmic energy and the divine power that moves through all creation. (Devi Mahatmya)

Divine Will.quote: Thy will be done, on earth as it is in heaven. (Matthew 6:10)

Tao.quote: The Tao is like a great flowing river, moving all things in its current. (Tao Te Ching)

Barakah.quote: Divine blessing flows as a continuous force from Allah to creation. (Islamic Tradition)

Mana.quote: Mana is the sacred spiritual force flowing through all things. (Polynesian Tradition)

Divine Grace.quote: By grace you have been saved through faith, and this is not your own doing. (Ephesians 2:8)

Orenda.quote: The spiritual power inherent in all things to affect change in the physical world. (Iroquois Tradition)

Divine Justice.quote: Justice rolls down like waters, and righteousness like an ever-flowing stream. (Amos 5:24)

Maya.quote: The divine force that creates the illusion of material existence. (Advaita Vedanta)

Ruach.quote: The divine breath that gives life to all creation. (Jewish Mysticism)

Asha.quote: The force of cosmic order and truth that maintains existence. (Zoroastrianism)

Divine Wisdom.quote: Wisdom has built her house, she has set up her seven pillars. (Proverbs 9:1)

Brahman Force.quote: That force by which the universe exists and into which it dissolves. (Upanishads)

Wyrd.quote: The force that weaves the threads of fate and destiny. (Norse Tradition)

Divine Mercy.quote: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. (Quran 1:1)

Shechinah.quote: The divine presence that dwells among the people. (Kabbalah)

Chi.quote: The vital force that flows through all living things. (Taoist Philosophy)

Divine Light.quote: The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overcome it. (John 1:5)

Ax√©.quote: The sacred force that enables all life to continue and prosper. (Yoruba Tradition)

Manitou.quote: The spiritual and fundamental force that flows through all things. (Algonquian Peoples)

Divine Order.quote: The force that maintains cosmic harmony and balance. (Egyptian Ma'at)

Pneuma.quote: The divine breath that animates all living beings. (Greek Philosophy)

Baraka.quote: The blessing force that flows from saints and sacred places. (Sufism)

Numen.quote: The divine force present in all natural phenomena. (Roman Religion)

Divine Truth.quote: The force of truth ultimately triumphs - Satyameva Jayate. (Sanskrit Tradition)

Lungta.quote: The wind horse that carries prayers and blessings through the cosmos. (Tibetan Buddhism)

Divine Harmony.quote: The force that maintains balance between heaven and earth. (Confucian Tradition)
